sn48.125-136:0.2: 13. Another Chapter of Abbreviated Texts on the Ganges, Etc.
sn48.125-136:1.1: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn48.125-136:1.2: In the same way, a mendicant developing and cultivating the five faculties slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn48.125-136:1.4: It’s when a mendicant develops the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, which culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn48.125-136:1.5: That’s how a mendicant developing and cultivating the five faculties slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
sn48.125-136:1.7: (To be expanded for each of the different rivers as in SN 45.91–102.)
sn48.125-136:2.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn48.125-136:2.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn48.125-136:2.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
